name: Hampton Inn & Suites Stamford

reviews.title: Great choice on a "spur of the moment decision"
reviews.text: We made reservations at this hotel 30 minutes before arrival and glad we did. What a nice hotel overlooking the city. It has a free parking garage "attached" to the hotel. The king bed suite room is huge and well appointed. Very clean. We were only there for about seven hours. Ate breakfast in the lobby which was very good and then hit the road. What staff we encountered were pleasant and helpful. We enjoyed our short night stay.

Stopped for an overnight with family on the way to a service in upper Manhattan. Great location . I think we got into the city in less than an hour. Room was very clean,king bed was so comfortable....loved it. Good night's sleep. Very interesting restaurant at the hotel....quite extensive Indian menu. Also had traditional American bar fare. Cant remember bartender's name, but he was very friendly and helpful, both with the Indian menu choices and directions to Manhattan. Who knew....an Irish bartender in an Indian restaurant in a hotel in Stamford, who went to Columbia and knew everything about N.Y. Perfect.
reviews.title: Good Value,Very Comfortable

reviews.text: Breakfast was great too..not just continental....eggs, sausage, fruit,waffles...everything and in a comfortable setting.
reviews.title: Good place for stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all,very nice hotel and a great value close to N.Y.C.
reviews.title: THE BEST VALUE IN THE AREA

reviews.text: If you're on the road and don't want to stay in NYC this is a great hotel. We first stopped at La Quinta and it looked pretty shady. The Hampton Inn wasn't just spacious and clean but nice. The breakfast was nice and although we wwere there for just over 12 hours it was enough for a good night sleep.
reviews.title: good overnight stop

reviews.text: The beds are very comfortable. Clean Rooms, friendly service. There was an event in the hotel and security did a great job by controlling the noise in the evening. Upon checkout, front desk staff great and breakfast was amazing.
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay
Nice hotel
reviews.text: Stayed here on our way to NYC. The hotel was easy to find. The woman at check in was very friendly as was the man at check out. Our room was very spacious and clean. There was a good size fridge and a microwave. The room was quiet and we couldn't hear the neighbours. There was a large breakfast area and plenty to choose from. Parking is free! There is a nearby shopping mall.
Would definitely recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: A good experiance, but some noises at night

reviews.text: A decent Hampton property located within walking distance of the city. The parking is covered ,and the staff are very courteous and knowledgeable about the area. I would advise driving to local restaurants as the surrounding area may not be safe during the evening hours.
reviews.title: Good place to stay outside of NYC

reviews.text: My reservation was correct, but I was accidentally booking into a room with two beds. The front desk moved me, but the room's A/C had not been activated. No problem, the room had sufficiently cooled after I returned from dinner. The staff recommended a great local pub inside the city. While it was a short walk, I did have to cross through several questionable areas. To their credit, the staff did offer their shuttle service to drive me.
reviews.title: It's ok
Reasonable price. Good for families. No "wow" factor.
reviews.text: This hotel is convenient and reasonably priced. Free parking is available on site, and you are within walking distance of downtown Stamford.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The highs:
reviews.title: Best way to visit New York City!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is overall clean, staff was friendly and free breakfast onsite made it easy to lug the kids down there in the morning. We booked a suite, which was quite large. We enjoyed having a DVD hookup in the room so the kids could watch movies.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!! Close train ride to NYC

reviews.text: The lows:
reviews.title: Hotel isn't bad but not walking distance from much

reviews.text: Our room, although nonsmoking, had a musty, smoky odor. The breakfast buffet was on the lame side. Good coffee, but the biscuits were like rocks and the eggs seemed like were made in the microwave. Can't complain about free, but it was not impressive.
reviews.title: Great budget bet when visiting Greenwich/Stamford

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby is closed -- it's under renovation. They don't make checking in an easy or friendly experience. Basically you have to go into the cramped back office to check in.
reviews.title: OK rooms, but lots of renovation going on

reviews.text: The hotel is not in a great part of town. The parking lot is not secure, so I didn't feel great about parking my car there overnight.
reviews.title: Consistent

reviews.text: The rooms, while clean, need some updating.
reviews.title: enjoyable

reviews.text: Just another Hampton Inn. You know what to expect. This one was a little older than most I've stayed in. But it was still just fine for a one night overnight. Consistent quality and service. The location was great. Easy to find and right in downtown Stamford.
reviews.title: Beware

reviews.text: Hotel entrance and room were very clean,staff was friendly and helpful. free parking and breakfast,good location. There is a on site reasturant, but hotel is a short walk from outdoor dining and shopping areas. No pool or hot tub, i think there was exercize room. We enjoyed our stay and the area near the hotel.
reviews.title: Convenient Location for Train To NYC

aka: Hampton Inn & Suites Stamford Hotel Stamford
description: The Inn at Mill River, located on the waterfront, is a hotel with peerless elegance, modern comforts & exceptional privacy. When the hotel opened in Year 1985 it had no parallel in the city and around. Although the hotel has seen much change, it has retained all of its original charm. For business or pleasure, hotel's spacious guest rooms & suites surrounded with residential ambiance offer an enclave of luxury in convenient downtown Stamford. Located on Mill River Street, easily accessible from I-95, I-287, Route 15, Route 1. Walking distance from downtown Stamford and local corporate offices. Five minutes from Stamford train station offering link to New York City.
